reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to throw you a bone here and give this a thumbs up, because I believe this game could truly start to become a great thing with a few more months of work..

But believe me when I say that I'm going to be brutally honest in what follows:

The things I liked:
1) Open ended Advancement; build your own unique class as you go, point by point, skill by skill. This is amazing and there are too few games doing this sort of system these days.

2) PvP to the nth power. if you're not in town, you're fair game. But death is not horribly penalized, so its okay.

The things I didnt:
The Developers are thus far, actively fixing the issues listed below, the review will be regularly updated as is appropriate.

1} A trip into the wastes will net a new, lowbie player between 200-600 Coins. Leather armor costs 88,500 coins per piece. No. Huzzah! I'm being told that this is not so bad as it was previously and that there is potential for big finds and that the general rate of earning has been evened out!

2) Crafting items requires materials (Makes sense, right?) but what you scavenge in the wastes are not the materials you need to craft items.. No, you scavenge the materials you need to make the materials you need to make items. This would be fine if I didnt need to make dozens of individual parts, each taking up at minimum a minute and a half of my time EACH. No.

3) You get the pellet gun pretty early on after doing a few quests, unfortunately, it's completely worthless since the starter shotgun has the ability to do dozens of points more damage and is, for some reason, just as accurate. In fact, all weapons seem to have roughly the exact same accuracy. No.

4) The english translations are misleading and faulty, telling you lies that ultimately end up wasting your time.

5) The game would be better WITHOUT the voice acting. I would rather read the text than hear these people speak. It is HILARIOUSLY awful. No, really, The voice acting in this game makes the voiceovers from Oblivion sound like a choir of angels. No. ♥♥♥♥ no.

6) Your inventory is limited by your strength, this makes sense, sure. But seeing as I literally cannot hold enough materials to craft a large majority of the items, this is pretty much game breaking. This issue is alleviated slightly by being able to place things in storage and just craft from there ... Oh wait..

7) There's absolutely no form of bulk storage whatsoever. Huzzah again! The Developers have added bulk storage. This also somewhat helps to alleviate the rigors of point 6 and makes it not such a glaring issue.

8) The game is only vaguely playable, but there is already a premium shop.

There is more to be said about this game, almost all of it negative. The concept behind everything would be amazing, in fact it would be a blast if any other part of it had been executed in any reasonable fashion.

I understand that this is an Alpha, but this game is not in an Alpha state.. All of these flaws should have been uncovered by a few hours of internal play testing by the developers.

I was excited about this title, but I can now say without doubt that you've made a genuinely terrible mistake in releasing this game in its current state. Chances are, any hope you had of generating a good early buzz around it are now completely gone and you've forced yourself into a long, grueling, uphill battle if you choose to persevere.

Good luck and I hope you have an ace up your sleeve. You're going to need it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fallout, multiplayer version?
PROS:    Beautiful graphics - showing the most desolate landscape intermittently dotted with life forms, hostile and almost alien
PvE you vs. a world where bandits and animals alike want a piece of you
PvP, FFA in the wastelands
Developed by one of the most customer-friendly company
Friendly (ish) community - who'll probably stab you in the back, but still take the time to let you know how to get around bugs
Addicting - One wonders how I actually found the time to type this out
FREE
CONS:    Certain bugs may be game breaking, but the devs will work on a fix ASAP
Gameplay still being balanced
PvP at your own risk - sometimes, rewards aren't worth it at all
Review: Fallout, Multiplayer Edition?
To be utterly honest, I read reviews before I get into a game, and I almost didn't want to play it at all, based on the amount of negative reviews, and the general mixed feelings the community has. But I was enraptured by the desolate Fallout feeling, and decided to give it a try. And boy, did I wish I didn't.

No, my last few days playing the SKIES wasn't without its share of game-breaking updates. No, I didn't coast through my playtime entirely happy. Yes, the last update prior to being fixed made me want to throw my entire gaming system in the direction of the game developers, hoping the rage will propel it further than a few feet.

Does any of that actually matter? No, because as soon as the problems arose, in only three hours, the devs were working on a fix. Less than 24 hours later, it had been fixed. And on top of that? They offered to restore the inventories of all the players who lost something to this update, manually. That's unimaginable customer service that few of us can even wish for, in the day and age of triple A games throwing post-launch day 1 DLCs that require you to pay again for the game that you just bought.

So, give it a try, why not? You may find yourself wandering the wastelands for hours, cheering and screaming profanity. But I don't regret the time I spent on this game, at all.

Alright all the  people who say the game isn't finished and that it shouldn't be on early eccess.

That the game has many bugs in it is because it is in early alpha, not ealry beta. So its theyre choice to put it out here so they can know faster what is wrong with the game and fix it.

if i had to rate it it would be in this state a 5.5 out of 10. But i will stick with it simply because it is still early alpha and can achieve great things. Don't hate on the game because its unfinished, that is exacly what early access is for.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Oh boy where do I even begin... (PLEASE READ REVIEW BEFORE SKIPPING)

Okay so The SKIES is a mmorpg set in a post apocalyptic style wasteland. The game has heavy focus on crafting and PVP. There us not much to say other then it feels and plays like other games such as Fallen Earth. It's been years since I've played Fallen Earth so maybe that's not the greatest comparison.

What to expect:

LOTS and I mean LOTS of bugs!
Open world PvP - YEP, no hand holding, grab your guns, your wives, and your kids because this is a harsh world! ;)
Heavy crafting, lots of items in this game are obtained through crafting or paying merchants.
Clans - Clan warfare which involves guarding and protecting players run cities, that's the impression though, don't believe player cities are implemeted yet.
Semi interesting NPC's and quests.

What not to expect:

DO NOT, and I seriously mean it. Do not expect a finished game.... this game has ♥♥♥♥ tons of bugs, the developers are actively working around the clock. Since ALPHA launch the game has seen a dozen patches. Most of which have further broken the game. Not compeltely to the point of no return, you can still play and run around. Farm materials and kill other players.

My verdict: 6/10

So far solid 6/10. I think the game has great potential. As it stands there way too many bugs that will make most players shy away from the game and not touch it with a 10 ft. pole. However it is a free game and there is content to be enjoyed despite the awful state it's in. If you like PvP then thats a huge plus, besides who doesn't like to run around with a gun and shoot little 12 year olds? ;)

(Will revisit game once in more stable state and will UPDATE review)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

needs a lot of work, but could out do fallenearth in a heart beat. In it's current state, it is very buggy,  but they have been updating it continously since launch, more updates than a lot of AAA studios do for bug fixes.

Updated 4/25/2016

The combat currently is all based on aimming skill, and dancing skill. There is no skill shots, just your build. Quite a few different items, and the game is in it's basic form of alpha.

They have been working hard on bug.fixes, right now the game is at the stage where they are just getting they're ideas together and testing them. They have been listening to the community and making changes as people have been begging.

The game is heavy on PvP, the only safe zone is the starter city, and the game has a long way to go.

Right now the only thing to do in game is beat up people, learn how to fight, and go from there. This game is still a alpha, you can tell but if you enjoy twitch based PvP this game will scratch that itch.

There is no debuffs/buff yet, and no skill shots so veteran Fe players will notice that difference.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game really does have a lot of potential.  It seems it will end up being an MMO cross between Mad Max and Fallout. Hopefully the hacks and exploits can get resolved before the game gets so toxic it is over before it even has a chance to begin. Players will kill you as soon as you move out of a safe zone, which are few and far between. PvE outside of a safe zone is pointless, as you will get sniped and killed by someone just for fun.
That being said, the game currently has massive cheating going on. You can get one shotted by someone who is not even on your map screen. I moved in all four directions out from the safe zone and was killed by the same person the instant I stepped out of the safe zone every time. The respawn point had dozens of other players, all apparently being killed at the same time by the same player.
NPCs can throw grenades farther than your rifle can shoot. Hackers and NPCs can shoot through walls, floors, and ceilings at a whim. Currently no in game system for reporting bugs/exploits/cheaters.
Crafting needs a lot of work still. You need a tech level of 9 to create component items that are needed to make a tech level 1 item. Crafting of subcomponents takes extraodinarily longer than it should.
Abandoning a broken quest is an automatic fail with NO CHANCE to go back and pick it up again and retry. This can potentially break an entire chain of quests.
The game is listed as being in early alpha stage. If actually true, then there is time for all of these things to be fixed. Patches seem to be happending quite often, but with little to no data log to show what has all been changed. Radiation was added without warning, and there is no indicator for a radiation zone until you character is already being affected by it.
Again, the game has loads of potential, but I would not recommend at this time.Give the developers a chance to get the hackers under control, or you will just be fodder for their exploits.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wasn't sure about this game at first with the mixed reviews it had but i thought i would give it a shot anyway. Well im glad i did I had a lot of fun playing over the last few days of playing. It took me a while to get to grips with how things work but after around 8 hours of playtime I've got to grips with it and i think I'm going to play a lot more.

I had a few issues on how things worked along the way so i posted on the forum for help and got good help from the community and even the devs were even quick to comment to help me.

Let me tell you one thing this game is no way pay to win and i am very glad about that, the only thing you need to pay for is an premium account which gives you bonus xp and in game cash. In the next couple of days i will be buying a premium account as i think the game is worth it and the devs have shown that they care about what the community want and they take time to read the comments on the forum as they did mine.

All in all a solid game with no major bugs which i hope is going to last and turn into a great free to play game.

This game needs a TON of work, however, it is PLAYABLE in its current state, so far i have managed to play through most of the quests i could find, break into some lock boxes, find some treasure( i dont want to be to revealing, but i will tell u, i found a chest ontop of a mountain with 3000 gold in it within my first like 20min playing)

il try to make some good points
in a few reviews people complained about being killed to early or whatever, well they kind of fixed that with the safe zone so quit ♥♥♥♥♥ing
next, people complained about the cost of things and whatever, well i think a few people may have mistaken the $ sign for a number as the text can be often hard to read, that being said navigating the text in questing can be a nightmare in a matter of minutes, i had even gone as far as to fail a quest not knowing what to say, and having to redo the whole quest
the game lags, yes it lags, whatever, deal with it in options if you can, or wait for more fixes
people dont really chat, or help each other, and they will kill you asap for no reason whatsoever other then to be a ♥♥♥♥ and make you walk( there is a quest for player killing i think maybe)
the combat system needs a ton of work but is interesting
crafting takes time, however i think its valid, maybe some items need to be reduced in time as the skill to bring the time down doesnt seem to be very effective at lv 4 :), maybe no issue when i get to lv 20 or so
no place to store items as i can see yet, however as the game is built on raiding i think, maybe better not to try having a lockbox? maybe a bank system where you pay for security? seems there is an aim for realism and i go as far as to say in a wasteland with a ton of people robbing each other you might not be able to keep ♥♥♥♥ locked up for long?
nexxxxttt... people have complained about the voice acting, hahaha yeah...i wonder how much is recorded for this game and if its EVEN possible to correct ANY of it hahaha, ( never thought though it might be computer simulated and go straight script)

IN CLOSING( cause really ♥♥♥♥ this) PLAY THIS GAME, maybe spend some money on it? i think it has a ton of potential, and if it can survive for a couple years with a good player base then cool, i would like to see it as a complete game!!

This game has insane potential, I could see myself having a lot of fun in this game specially if I play it with friends but as it stands now the game is in a very messy clumsy place.

The thing that kept me hooked in this game is that the character building and rpg aspects of the game are very well done, best attribute/character building I have seen in a while, it reminded me a bit of vampire the masquerade in the sense that if you build a certain type of character you suffer in other areas, example, you build with non-combat stats, you will suffer in combat and will most likely want to avoid combat until you make up for that or if you are forced to fight, this gives a sense of self in the game, you're just a person and every other player has different stats and different advantages, you can survive by yourself doing things your own way or you can complement yourself with other people.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Gameplay wise this game is terrific.
-Open-world pvp(can be looked as a pro or con(I say it's a pro in my opinion))
-Traditional fps with first or third person mode
-Vast skill point system similar to fallout*
-Interactive storyline/missions (For instance in a mission, you can either report the guard for doing drugs to the sherrif or give the drugs to the guard)
-Able to free-roam not restricted to area
-decent visuals
-Good store system in which you can see other player's sold items
-Npcs for the most part have different options to them, e.g repair item,get quest,trade
-Functionable group system
-Megaservers so all players are on the same server
-Different chat options dependent on your intelligence
-Crafting system

Cons:
-The voice acting is horrible.
-No bank or storage system
-Stealing does not work currently
-Some settings such as FOV are missing however will be added later according to the Dev.
-No cashshop but there's a premium service

Performance:
-It's ok considering the devs are optimizing and I went from 20-30fps in towns to 50fps in towns after 2 patches released by the devs
-Specs are i5 6600k, gtx 970, 16gb

What I think of the game at its current state?

At the current state, I think this game will only improve. The developers of this game do care about the state of it. One of the developers added me and heard my problems and opinions and told me he/she was sorry about the pitful launch however hope to regain their reputation back. I do believe this game has great potential and backed up with these amazing devs I believe it'll be come a great game. I do wish the developers would instead of having the premium service, have cosmetics similar to path of exile. Overall, I'd rate this game a 7/10.
tldr: good developers listens to its fanbase, rough launch but has great potential. Optimization seems to coming along also.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: Message for the devs: Please fix the instancing issue causing players to not show up on each others screens even when in a party, or at least add a channel select button.

(After this review is a recountment of my first hour of playing)

The SKIES is a pvp focused open world FPS/TPS MMO amalgamate based in a massive desert wasteland....

The game itself tries to combine open world pvp and the questing PVE environment of MMO's into a single game.
The SKIES system of quest giving is operated through attribute requirements to trigger quests, and dialog responses are managed through a mesurement of your intelligence attribute, making you either sound like either a complete dumbass or the second re-incarnation of cassanova in dialogue. The game's open world pvp can be a turn off for some as a lot of people are worried of being ganked without reason, (See Mortal online) however it does not really matter much as from what I can understand, nothing is lost on death, besides durability which by it self degrades with continual weapon and equipment use. The trade system can also be a little confusing at first as it can have some first time players who may have played games such as fallout and fallout 2 in the past believe that it works like fallout's barter system, however the difference text in this game defines how many coins you will either obtain after trade or lose after trade. The optimization is also pretty buggy near big towns and server shutdowns are regular occurances. The exit to the starting area also tends to be camped by PK'ers attempting to test their luck. However I can definitely see some potential in this Early access Early alpha game even though I am not much of a fan of the open pvp idea.

Pros
-----
- Combat is pretty solid at the time of this review.
- Wasteland 2 style wasteland.
- Both FPS & TPS cameras.
- Instanced PVP match making for those not wanting to be tagged as killers in the open world.
- Attention to detail with dialogue choices based on intelligence.
- Crafting system
- Town based safe zones
- PVP world map capture points for clan based PVP players.


Neutral
--------
- Open PVP can be a turn off for some.
- Constant server reboots for bug fixing.
- Casuals need not worry about dying in PVP due to kept inventory.

Cons
------
- Audio for weapon reloads finish quicker than the actual reload timer.
- Bad Optimization near cities.
- Framerate feels capped though I don't see a V-sync option in settings.
- A bit buggy as a given for Early Alpha gameplay.
- First person camera has a head bob that can not be turned off.

---------------------------------------------------
Recount of first hour of Gameplay
---------------------------------------------------
I create my character, looking a bit bland as the character creator is no where near complete. I then spawn into the farm where all new players go. I wake up and get out of bed, I talk to the MC's uncle and then proceed to loot the wardrobe for fresh clothes as I move to the kitchen, I loot all the weapons and equipment from the starter area and move complete all the starter quests, I leave the farm, shotgun and knife (Which I had to level up cold weapons to equip) in hand. Upon leaving the farm I load in to the sounds of gunshots and running, I notice a white name plate player next to me firing at another white name plate, given my good samaritan status that I feel the need to uphold I fire my shotgun into the back of the firing player, this kills him instantly and gives me the killer debuff turning me into a red-tag player for the next hour. I run to town trying my best to avoid all the PK'ers that were waiting to hunt me and other new players down. Upon entering the town I fail to find a job or anything else to do, so I sit at the gate and watch passerbys while recounting my stats and currency. I notice two white players running together away from the gates, a few moments later a red-tag wearing armor follows the two white players. Given my experience with Day-Z I knew what would happen if he caught up to them, so naturally with my dexterity build self, I chase him down but not before waiting for him to get into the open. I fire three shells into him, the second shell missed, he dies and I gain 6xp. The announcement for a server reboot to fix a bug with the job system occurs and I run around for a bit collecting mushrooms before returning to town. The server shuts down for the next 15 minutes and I think, what a day.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe Skies has a lot of potential and presents a creative vision. If the game continues on the path it's on I would not mind paying for it in the future but for now I would not want to pay for this game in its current is filled with bugs. As far as I've gotten in learning the game mechanics it seems that crafting time is reduced for paying players, It does not feel like pay to win. Overall I like the lack of hand holding and difficulty in the game which can be infureating and creates a long grind which I enjoy but others might not. I'd like to see where this game is going.

I could not even play 2 hours because the loading takes so long and sometimes the game hangs and I have to alt-F4 and restart and so on.

BUT:
I like it.
The graphics are good enough to not be ugly...or even better, I do not really think about them, so they are good enough for me at least.
The handling is ok, a bit sluggish but not enough to be a reason to not try the game.

I can not really say why I like the game, it is just fun to play the first area (farm).
So, what do I need more than: it is fun to play the game?
Only one more thing, it should be possibel to play, and there is currently a problem. No idea if it is the client or the servers or my connection but I will for sure retry this game because I like it.

Crafting is done in two steps, resources -> materials -> products.
You can harvest resources with your hand, not sure if you get more or it is faster with tools.
I got stone, wood, clay, berries and wheat with my hands, just use e" and wait half a second until the harvesting is done.

This game wasnt for me....It's a bit buggy, feels a little turn based, and its set up like an mmo. The female model isnt in yet so my wife wont play, and the community is a little rough. It's a bit of a time sink and the skills arent really detailed enough....youll have to restart your game when you figure out whats what.

That being said....the game has potential, its free, and they let you buy the real money credits for in game money, thus making it....not pay to win. I really respect this and the devs for making this decision, ultimately the game isnt for me, but who knows, the next one they make might be.

Early Access Review

Although I have not played the WHOLE story yet, this game is very entertaining. The story seems good (up to my point), and the partyplaying really did have a good advantage in getting this game, so that when you play with friends it is entertaining. Weapons are kind of repetitive at the beginning of the game (you can find the starter weapons literally EVERYWHERE around you), and SIDE QUESTS ARE REALLY IMPORTANT FOR PROGRESSION IN THE GAME AS WELL, as they will help you to level-up –better gear, help you even travel across the map.
IF YOU HAVE A LAPTOP, MAKE SURE YOU HAVE AT LEAST THE RECOMMENDED, NOT MINIMUM, SPECS AS EVEN THE RECOMMENDED SPECS ARE QUITE LOW.
Overall, I would rate this a 8/10 (for now). Recommended.

Pay to win.

They gave coins you pick up off mobs, buy stuff with, etc.

That doesn't even begin to address the glitch cheaters who made billions on the game and were rewarded with gold when the devs wiped a no wipe server.

This game is dying....devs are cashing out....even though it is free don't waste your time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The SKIES is a 3rd Person Open-World MMORPG set in a sandy, post-apocalyptic landscape with a nonlinear storyline and the ability to do whatever you want.

When The SKIES is loaded up, players can start off by customizing a character to what suits them. Compared to other games the character customisation is extremely limited, with only tattoos, face shape, eyebrows, eye colour, hair colour and skin colour as the only variables with only a few options for each. There is also only the option to make a male character. I would definitely like to see more character customisations as this is a key factor in MMORPGs.

The SKIES starts you off with a bit of a story. Spawning in a small settlement, the tutorial phase is just a few quests with your parents before you leave towards Kimary and start the game for real. The tutorial is extremely short and doesn’t really give a good introduction to the game. For me, when I left the tutorial zone, I was lost as to what to do and confused as to what my options were.

I could only really start ‘enjoying’ the game and doing quests when I realised (with a bit of help from some players) that there was an order in which you had to do the quests in. Although lots of people were marked as quest givers, only a few were available. This threw me off a bit.

The SKIES is ridden with bugs, but this is expected as it’s a beta game. A few bugs that I found were animals spawning halfway in the ground and textures for players not loading properly. I also found the walking animations to be slightly off. When you jump, the running animation does not start instantly when landing and also some objects that you shouldn’t be able to step up can be climbed, this causes for a weird animation the character just seems to float up the side of the object. Conversely, probably the most simple of bugs but the one having the biggest impact on gameplay means walls can be looked through if pressed up against it. People can use this to their advantage to find other players and I definitely think this is a bug that should be fixed in the near future.

HUD overlapping: http://i.imgur.com/73neXjO.png
Untextured player: http://i.imgur.com/pN5Bodm.png
Animal in the ground: http://i.imgur.com/cUFJL2i.png
Looking through walls: http://i.imgur.com/v4uF9Js.png

This might just be for me, but also, my game always seems to crash when I try to close it.

The game also seems really grindy. When you start off, you literally start with nothing other than a bump, a small gun that fires stones and does near to no damage. Masses amounts of in game money are needed to buy any good equipment, and even when you do get it, you need a high level in order to use it.

The easiest way to get stuff is to buy it with your real money, otherwise it’s really grindy. Or, a cheaper option: just find a website that’s giving away codes and just get a bunch of them. This way you get a bunch of free items without having to do anything!

Completely unfair.

Despite the map being immense and filled to the brim with other players and entities, the game is well optimised compared to other games of the same style. It can be run easily at 40 frames per second with near to no choppiness. There are many graphics options to enable less powerful PCs to run the game, but don’t expect any old, low end PCs to run the game as it still requires a half decent computer at least.

Playing by myself, I found the game difficult to have fun on and almost tedious in the way that the gameplay is laid out. I can see how this game can be fun, but without friends I don’t really see where the gratification comes in. I know the idea of the game is that there is no clear objective and you’re free to do what you want, but this almost makes the game feel pointless and I struggled to get into the game. I spent most of my time running around, getting confused, getting lost and dying to random scarabs.

Despite this, I see that there is definitely a good game hidden behind the grind and confusion. In my opinion, this is a game that can’t really be played on your own. I really like the idea and it is probably a game I could see myself playing with a few friends.

Nevertheless, it’s ridden with bugs and not fun.

3/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay. I don't know if I recommend this game or not, in all honesty, I mean, it's a good concept, but..


The aiming is literally worse than anything I've ever seen, I can't shoot a scarab 3 feet in front of me unless I aim at the ground?

Not to mention I spend 95% of the game walking backwards because ALL of the mobs are faster than me only slightly, and I have to shoot them before thye can get to me, which, they can hit me from like 5 feet away with their tiny claws(??)
usable Iron Sights would be a huge plus, but no, it's typical side scoping most games seem to think is acceptable for using guns, becasue yes, everyone aims down the side of their gun and leans forward a little instead of using the Iron Sights, because why would you want to do something as silly as use those, right?

I got sniped by a player the same level as me and he was almost a speck in the distance, he killed me in one shot without any misses or issues, just turned around and bam I was dead, and I can barely shoot a few feet ahead of me, let alone do any decent damage, inb4 I am a rifle build, and my rifle does literally ♥♥♥♥ damage, a lot of improving is needed, mostly with the Aiming and lest not forget, Melee combat, try to swing at someone and go straight through you as they turn around instantly and wack you in the back, boom, dead, get stuck in rocks and fall through phantom objects, all in all this game needs work, I mean it's early access so it's understandable but some of these issues are basic whne the game first was made they should have been fixed, like the grand lack of Iron Sight usage, and the aiming incapabilities, I do hope to see this game go far, it is fun, hopefully the female char will come out soon and it won't be manlandia anymore,


The Computers have an uncanny ability to know exactly where you are at any given moment, I was sneaking through a house and heard endless gunfire, come to find out ALL of the enemes, 3 stories ABOVE me who had no way of knowing  was there, were aiming straight down and shooting at where I was standing, 3 stories down, and the dogs will find you, no matter what, they will find you.

Wake up. Find out you're ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Find stick. Find dogs. Beat dogs to death. Eat dogs. Get teleported by vortex of magic dust. Respawn as floating stick. Pull out gun your uncle gave you. reviewText:
Early Access Review

An attempt to make a Fallout MMO that fails heavily in its current state (pre-alpha). Could be a good game in 2-3 years, but right now it is a waste of time and money.

You basically run around and shoot things that either kills you randomly or the AI is too stupid to even turn around. You can also craft, but unless you insert money, even the most basic things take 4-6 minutes to complete and you are unable to queue items, rendering the whole concept basically useless, unless you have a click-bot that does the crafting for you.

The whole game reeks of pay2win, the fact alone that a _pre-alpha_ game has a cash shop tells me where this is heading to.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm going to give this game a like rating purely because I love the open PVP and clan control
However this game in its current state is completely and utterly broken

This game needs voip
we need a better tutorial.  I spawned and didn't know wtf to do, I just went out and PK'd which is fun, but I'd like to actually be able to interact with other players rather than killing on site which is why we need voip.  There needs to be clear quests that give me starter gear (armor + a better gun) and I need to be told how I can make in game currency
PVP --- From what I've played, you die too fast.  Armor + new guns might change this, but low level PVP is pretty much no risk no reward.  You don't stand to gain or lose anything from it.  I'd like to see players dropping ammo or something on death
Control areas should be bigger and it should be harder to take them than it currently is.  Individuals should not be able to own land, it should be left to clans.   When other clans try to take areas it should lead to huge clan wars (like in Face of Mankind)
There are a bunch of bugs and the game just feels unpolished while I play it.  I still believe in the project and wish you guys the best.  I'll check back in a couple of months.  Hopefully you'll have fixed a lot!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I recommend this for people who don't mind checking out early alpha and beta products.  The landscape for alpha and beta has changed a lot in the last several years and this game is what alpha's truly used to be.  It's pretty rough right now, by no means even close to finished.

I can't recommend this for anyone looking for a new shiny stable MMO, there are still way too many issues to resolve.  Having said that, this game has the foundation to be one of the best MMOs that I've ever played.

Biggest issues for me right now:

1) Tutorial is very sparse and the confusing dialog doesn't do that any favors
2) The few fights that I tried, I got owned pretty badly
3) The dialogue and voice acting leave a lot to be desired.  To the point that they shouldn't have even bother recording voicework for the game yet if they intend to replace what's already there, and believe me they need to

Positives:

1) Lot's of dynamic gameplay potential.  There were lots of items to pick up and use.  Reminds me of Fallout or Elderscrolls games in that regard
2) Very interesting stat and progression system
3) For an alpha, it actually looks and plays pretty well

All in all, I'd recommend it for someone who wants to keep up with it as it gets better, but not for someone looking for a new finished game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I suppose it’s a first serious project for these developers. Undoubtedly, they are doing very well. I play with my comrades. But I just started to play and they are playing for 2 weeks or something. That’s a pleasure to hear only good things about first project of «young» developers. My comrades are really satisfied, so do I. they taught me how to play here, what should I do and etc. What can I say about the game itself?
Pros:   1) Really nice graphics and design of characters.
2) Kind and helpful community. When I played alone, I found that not only friends can help you. That was nice 
3) It is a game in early access, but there is really low level of bugs. My friends said sometimes they meet it, but I didn’t meet it still.
Cons: 1) Game is still not so popular, I’d like to see more players.
2) Many patches to download! (joke)
Actually, I can’t say anything bad about this product. Just try it and you will see why.

Theres my review, now for some thoughts and ideas ;)

1. Add motion blur, *For first person and third* *as a option*

6. mabey add more to the Health system? Like food, water, ETC

7. You may be planning on this already, but add different areas, *Forest* *snow? I have no idea why*

8. Just like thought number seven, You may already be planning this, but may you add more character customization?


Those are all my suggestions, ideas and thoughts! *For now* hope you guys can see this! :D

So my bud found this game and told me to get it . I had second thoughts about downloading it . You might aswell say I have perfect hindight .
So the game finished downlaoding and we jump in . We customize our character with the three face selections we were given . You spawn at a farm with your aunt and Uncle and they give you some quests with one of the best voice acting you can get . I lied . The chat is very lazy it makes you think that your character has a mind of a 13 year old American Teenage girl .. Ughhh ... mmm. Yea " "Ughhh... hmmm ... Ahhh . No" You finish the quests and you are rewarded with a pie for killing off 5 dogs and getting some berries . You finally get out and even if you are on the same server you cant find your friend .
You just die because everybody already has a shotgun and the lag is jsut ♥♥♥♥ing amazing you cant get more than 20 fps with the lowest settings set . Once you die you teleport still with all your gear to a town that is one of the laggiest ♥♥♥♥♥ you will ever experince in a game .
I ran around sold some berries to some girl and my friend tells me to look at the skybox . One of the laziest skyboxes I have ever seen . The creaters did most of their work in Microsoft paint just from the look of that skybox . The Animations are crap. I have a screenshot on my profile that pretty much summarizes the entire game .

0/10

The one aspect most ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes don’t get is that disbalance and donations. Not once when roaming around the world I was killed with super-pupa-donated-player. The game does a fantastic job of constantly creating a balance, it’s f2p, but you can’t become stronger, when you donate a lot. Even when you realize that the penalty for death is minor (since last patch), you still find yourself trying your hardest to stay alive.

You can easily spend a lot of hours and fans of MMORPGs, or post-apocalyptic games in general, really need to check out The Skies.

It really manages to suck you in and deliver a good time.

++ The Good ++

+ Partyplaying is very enjoyable
+ Crafting has a great variety
+ Smash a monster – save humanity
+ Shooter elements are well-done

-- The Bad --

- Cover system during gun battles is a little weird
- Generic story and repetitive side-quests
- Early access game

reviewText:
Early Access Review

OverviewGameplay: 5/10
Sounds: 5/10
Multiplayer: 5/10
Graphics: 6/10

Pros & Cons+ Voiced quests
+ Large map
+ Good mix of RPG shooter
+ Great class skill tree
- Average/poor voice acting
- Stiff animations
- No real tutorial or introduction to gameplay mechanics
- Not well optimized
- Buggy

ConclusionThis review is subject to change; at the moment I would not reccomend this game, it's clearly in the barebone state but there is alot of potential here. For a free-to-play Skies feels really high quality, and you can tell the developers put in serious effort. Already this game more fleshed out than some of the other early access survival titles, however as said before it's a mess right now. Give it some time and I'm sure the score will go to a 6 or a 7.

5/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game and the graphics are nice, I would be happy to reccomend it but in its current state it really is unplayble!

I know what Alpha means and i backed plenty of them but never before i had a case where the game is totaly unplayble. This feels like a few stages before Alpha. I cant really say a bad word about them as the game is FREE... but i think it is at list 6 months away from being an actuall multiplayer Alpha. For the life of me i dont really understand why did they even release it now... all they did is just creat a bad reputation for themselfs.

The list goes like this:

1) Constant disconnections - many players including myslf are getting disconnected every 5-10 min from the game...its a known issue but after planty of posts about it they dont seem to be able to fix it. You cant ebjoy the game if cant bloody play it.

2) Crushing trigers - Talking to NPC's , collecting stuff from the ground, completing quests cuase in many cases the game to crush.

3) Trading is bugged, Quests are bugged.


It a really fairly nice game.... but its not even Alpha i am afriad. So i would say that i do not recomand this game NOW...but in 6 months when they fix some of those isseus...then yea i would be happy to come back.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

INGREDIENTS

1.5kg (3lb) loin pork, with fat attached and rind removed, tied with string
2tbsp olive oil
1.5l (48fl oz) milk
50g (1¾oz) butter
6 cloves garlic, peeled and split in half
2 unwaxed lemons, peel removed
METHOD

Heat the oven to 160°C (gas mark 2-3). Season the pork well with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat the oil in the bottom of a large casserole or frying pan over a medium heat. Add the pork and slowly cook until golden. Remove it from the pan and wipe out the excess fat with kitchen paper.
Bring the milk to just under the boil in a large saucepan. Heat the butter in the casserole. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, then add the pork.
Add enough of the milk to come about a third of the way up the side of the pork. Drop the strips of lemon peel (minus any white pith) into the milk and bring to the boil.
Cover with foil or a lid, and transfer to the oven. Cook for 1 hour then remove the cover and continue to cook for a further 30 minutes. Spoon off and discard any fat. Serve the pork in slices, accompanied with the reduced milk.
top tips

The milk will reduce to a lovely, soft, golden, lemony curd. Spoon this around the meat when you serve it.


This game is bad.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe games needs a lot of work.  There is no way to report bugs. Important places in towns are not labled on the map so you have to go around everywhere to try to find things.  Chat is useless. No one answers any of your questions.  Many of the people playing are just doing it to kill other players. They will wait by spawns to kill players as they log in to maps.  I spent a whole hour trying to find a workbench to craft something and its not labled (still haven't found it) and no one will help you in chat.  I would say that this is a pre-alpha and these things are games 101 and should have been addressed before the beta launch. The game reminds me a lot of Fallen Earth but with tons of bugs.

I played for 100 minutes, then i logged off for the night. Came back the next day, and my character's stats have been erased. Gone from lvl 5 to 0, nothing in my inventory. So basically i got to start over every time i play this game.

The game it self needs a litteral sh!tton of optimization, and have an equal amount of potential. But it need's a lot of work. And until it actually starts saving my character, i cannot recommend this game to anyone.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I feel like there is decent groundwork that has been laid, however The Skies feels far to early into development for an Early Access release. That being said, it is a free-to-play title so this balances things out somewhat but microtransactions are in the game. It has potential, but needs an entire overhaul of it's lighting systems, character models, user interface and questing mechanics. One of the lighting options drops your FPS drastically when enabled and there is very little to no improvement visually. Once again, I'll say that there is a decent free-to-play title that could come from this, but currently the game is not worth anybody's time.

Don't get me wrong, it's got a whole lot of potential. But right now it's not worth taking up space on your hard drive. Start the game and you get an incredibly laggy screen after 3 full minutes of loading the game up. It took me 20 full seconds to find the character creation screen. (alveit probably because i'm just dumb) Character customization" is abysmal. From what I could tell you can't rotate your character
date: so I couldn't see that I actually had a ponytail with the hair that i chose from ~5 hairstyles. The only body customization is a few tattoos. You can pick from something like 5 different faces
recommended: but they're all abysmal and make the character look like he REALLY needs to get to the bathroom. Oh
hoursPlayed: and you can't change the gender of your character yet. There are like 15 different skills to level up
voteText: and personally I think that's a bit too much. If there was a tutorial button
helpfulPercent: I didn't see one. reviewText: Early Access Review\n\ni played this game without any expectations and it was great. i am not saying that the game is perfect actually it is quite the opposite. it is full of flaws that need fixing but i havent seen a game with such potential in al ong time. I would WAIT AT LEAST A MONTH beforep laying it tho because there are alot of bug/glitch (char being wiped out when it takes 30 minutes to craft an item in order to finish the first quest...)By the way who the ♥♥♥♥ had the idea of adding a wait time for the crafting??? i hope you devs fire this guy because it is just the stupidest thing i have ever heard of... You spend about 1 hour farming the required material to craft your new piece of equipment in order to advance but then they tell you that it will take 45 minutes to craft your boots... and you need to craft boots,pants,chest piece,helmet, weapon ... so after 5/6 hours you can actually advance to the next quest... yep dont play this game unless you want to idle for a day... if you could actually play the game it would be one of the best mmo ever released but you just cannot play it you can wait in the game tho (basically the only thing you can do)

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSo before I begin to say anything just make note that I don't normally write reviews for games. Though the rating for this game is Mixed" So there for I am upvoting this to give them my support. Now also make note that this review won't be  giving pros and cons. Look at other reviews for that information or give the game a shot... its free to play
date: it can't hurt to try.\n-----\nSo from what I have done so far
recommended: "The Skies" is a FP/TPS MMORPG. You start off by waking up in a bed in the house of your aunt's and uncles farm. Right away
hoursPlayed: I have the option to do what I want. I go into my dresser and put on my clothes. I get a gun right away
voteText: called the "Bumper" The bumper is a gun that looks to be crafted and uses stone as ammo. Stone can be aquired literally all over game. Now I can choose to help my aunt and uncle around the farm for some goodies and  exp
helpfulPercent: or I can just leave and go off and explore. Doing quest's in this game is 100% optionable. You can get everything in this game and not do a single quest. There's so many different skills to go into and to level up. You make your own "class." I guarentee you
votesHelpful: not one person's stats will be exactly the same unless you follow a guide. There are safe zones and pvp zones. I have explored in the pvp zone for more then half of the time I played and only once have I been in a pvp fight. I have run into people who are generally friendly and wont harm you unless you harm them. I checked out the crafting system in this game and I barely even knew where to begin. There is so much you can craft
votesTotal: and if you dont feel like crafting you can always trade with other players or search the shops. The shops have items in them that people have sold which makes this game very unique because in most games the shop items are adjusted and are very limited. You can also do everything in this game and not spend a single dollar. The payment system in this game is not pay to win at all. You pay to speed things up
votesFunny: this is great for people who have busy lives and dont have lot's of free time. What really shocked me was the membership in this game. It's $9.99 a month and for a limited time only you can pay $14.99 and be a member for life! Theres so much more I can go on about and I will be editing this review as I continue through my experience. The game is buggy
commentsCount: yes
column16: but if you can look past the bugs then this game is very promising and very fun and enjoyable."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The UI isn't very legible on lower-res displays (1366x768). Doesn't properly fullscreen, and has a low framerate. Controls also aren't very responsive.

However, this is an Early Access title, which means the game is NOT complete. The graphical detail, on the other hand, is quite good. The game shows promise. I hope to try it again when the kinks are worked out.

The graphics are poorly optimized.

The animations are glitchy.

Be glad this game is free, otherwise this company would be sued.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is a quite enjoyable game with great potential! As it is in early Alpha it needs work but that is to be expected.
Some things that I think need to be fixed are:
-Combat, the bots have insane aim, and will hit you 9/10 times, even if you are running
-Combat, the mechanics of combat are laggy and slow to respond, allowing weak opponents to sink hits they otherwise couldn't and putting some serious disadvantages on me in PvP combat.
-The Tutorial level needs to show you how to play the game a little better than it does currently
-The map needs a little less empty space, and an easier way to get around, becuase as is, I spend 10 minutes walking around a wasteland, and killing only 5 or so enemies, and not finding any cities or villages or other players, yet the second I get killed I teleport back to the city and have to walk out for another 10 minutes or more just to find something.
Overall it is a great game with a huge amount of potential, and I cannot wait to see where this game goes.
P.S adding vehicles would be really cool. Also allowing the community to set up servers, so that you and your friends could create a private server would be great. :]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game really does have a lot of potential. As clunky and confusing the mechanics are at first, as glitchy and poor the combat is, and as hilariously horrific the voice acting is, there is a solid foundation one can make a GREAT game out of. You can feel the MMO aspect in the basics of it and there is an immersive, apocolyptic feel in the surroundings. It certainly could be a lot worse than it is now.

Don't be discouraged when you try it out. Just know it's very, very bare bones. It's a good chuckle to play currently, but hopefully it'll be a serious game later in development.

The early permium already does make me uncertain, but the developers could use the extra dough I'm sure. You can still access the game for free and play the limited content there is currently.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you can't do something simple like invert the mouse axis, you don't have a game. If you don't need an inverted mouse to aim good luck with the clunky interface. The crafting system is horribly slow in regards to what you need versus ability to gather the materials. And the first random quest outside the shoddy story line didn't work. Killed 5 raiders and none of them counted even though I was in the designated area. Don't bother wasting your time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is in early alpha. Ok, let me say that one more time before you continue reading...EARLY ALPHA.

Here's the game in a nutshell:

-Mad Max mixed with Fallout
-Decent atmosphere that really gives the apocalyptic vibe
-Character progression is fun and reminds me of fallout
-Combat is 50/50 - Can be fun, but also frustrating
-Personal storage was just patched in recently so +1 for the devs there
-Graphics are a solid 5/6-10 at the moment, but I'm sure they will get better over time
-The voice acting is either meh or just downright hilarious-The game would be better with no voices at all, but you can skip through the bad voiceover
-Crafting times are hilariously long, but I think the devs will update those sooner or later

VERDICT/TLDR- Good game that needs a little bit of work/polish. Worth a try considering it's free and has the potential to outclass Fallen Earth. The devs also seem to be responsive on their steam page so give them a ring there if you have additional questions or feel free to ask me!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Seeing that this game is in early alpha, I can't say I expected much.

This game is OK for what it is, a early alpha game. Its almost entirely non-linear, past the tutorial area, the entire game opens up. Skills are a bit wierd however (It takes almost 40 points in the travel skill to get some gas in the wastelands, but eh.) And the aiming is rather wierd for a third person game. Aiming is almost next to impossible, even with a pellet pistol. And sometimes (Although this just could be me with a bad internet connection) Enemys will somehow hit me, even though I am a mile away, causing some issues with trying to play, and with the rather... Buggy... 'Aiming', Fighting NPCs is a chore, and if its a large group, you are dead, because some how you can get hit from behind. The crafting system is very strange also, it took about 20 minutes to craft a leather jacket (Ok I guess), 13 for a pair of leather pants, and /30 MINUTES/ for boots. I mean, seriously? In this games current state, I can not say I recomend the game. Due to its rather... Odd bugs. However, the game is in early alpha, and I hope the devs work on some of the stuff.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For all the Up's and the downs of this Game I still highly reccommend it to anyone who is just looking to enjoy a Decent Shooting MMO. Yes the bugs in this game are real, but the Devs update this game constantly and it just keeps getting better and better. What people need to Realize is that Early Alpha is just that. If you feel your time can't be wasted on a game because it is it's early stages well good for you. But overall with all the stuff wrong with this game, there is still alot of stuff that is right. I give it  a solid 8/10 simply for the fact updates are constant, Devs work really hard, Gameplay mechanics have the potential to be amazing and im sure it will be. If you miss out on some cool stuff because you CBA to play this game in Early Alpha I feel bad for you XD


Bugs have been fixed mostly still a little stuff here and there i have never seen a more dedicated Developer Team. Even through all the stuff that broke the game" the devs have done the best they can to fix it. Thank you for making such a great game. The only thing that i can ask is that the clan system be updated but thats not even a big thing its just a personal thing that i would like to see.

It is an easy game to get into and i would play it alot more if i had the time to
date: my last review up above i gave this title and 8/10 after seeing the devs team dedication and how the game has evovlved in such a short period of time i seriously cant to anything but give this game a 10/10 rating"

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

I was going to wait til 100 hours of game play, but I just can't see my thought on this game changing. I have put about 45 hours into this game now, and I can say it is very addictive. If you enjoy a Sandbox, open world game, Take a few and read my review on this game or even try it!

Pros :

Crafting Varity :

The number one thing I want to point out is that when it comes to the processing line or your (product line) for crafting, I have noticed alot of people saying that it is broke, and they can only craft 1 item, UNLESS they are Premium. Wrong, increase your Mastery skill. Done. I have found it easy and rather cheap to make my own ammo for my weapons in this game, I have premium, and 20 mastery, 20 mastery provided me with 1 extra crafting slot, yes that seems a little crazy, 20 stat points for one crafting slot. BUT those 20 points are on your passive skills, if you level up your

Quests (LOTS) :

In Kimary the first city you arrive at after the tutorial, you can obtain a quest from practically any NPC, BUT some and most NPC's require a specific level of skill before they will give you said quest. Alot of the quests can be super simple too! alot are just errands for lazy merchants. I personally love rich stories, alot of differnet stories to listen too, or even help out the local troubled citizen with their person issues.

Resources Every where! :

Ahhh, one of my favorites, gathering resources. In Kimary all around the city, in the city, wait... EVERYWHERE there is resources for you to gather, from wood, cotton, chrome, steel, coal and so on and so on. I have found that gathering resources in this game is actually pretty quick. Correct me if im wrong PLEASE, but I believe if you level up your Traveling skill, you will begin to see that instead of getting 1 per gather, you'll start to get multiple. Im at about 60 Travel, gathering is anywhere from 3-4 per gather.

Fast Mob Spawns :

One of the best feelings and alot of people will agree with this, I can stay in one area, and not have to run around all over the map just to get 15 kills. there are alot of different areas that have 5-10 mobs in each group. and take no more then 30 seconds to respawn. Yes the elite's (what I call the strong mobs) can take awhile to spawn, but thats the point. For example in Lighthouse, the second map there are Scarubs (stronger then the ones in Kimary) one that looks like the ones in Kimary, and one that has a purple glow to it. The purple ones (elites) give me about 5 times the exp and coin.

Stat System :

The Stat system in this game is absolutely awesome.  You have passive skills, and your base skills, I.E your base stats consist of, Strength, Endurance, Dexteriety, Inteligence, Technology, and luck. Pretty self explainitory if you have played an RPG before. Passive skills have alot of effects on weapons, armor, crafting etc.

Auction House :

Do I have to explain this? it gets you cheap gear, and makes you rich. DONE!

The Little Things :

Common who doesn't goto the local bar on games and get smashed? Or do the Chicken dance in the street?  Its a sand box people, you don't have any objectives! Enjoy the little things.

Cons :

-Shared World/Killed Loot

Hands down the most annoying thing ever, especially when your off killing a mob, and some underwear pirate (♥♥♥♥♥♥♥) runs up and jacks your loot from your kill. The shared world resources I can see that being a thing, it is a sandbox openworld after all, Survival of the fittest!

Early Alpha -

I tend to laugh at this one alot, especially after reading the review's, PEOPLE have you looked above the mini map?? See how it says Early Alpha? IT MEANS ITS EARLY! This game isn't perfect, no it's not tended to be at this stage in their development, they are providing access to this game for us so we can test it for them, so WE can enjoy a game that is for ****FREE**** Yes there are some minor glitches (Bound to happen on any early access game), Hub complications etc, there are 15 guides on steam, the beginners guide helped me learn the game in speedy time. Writing decent review's and actually giving feed back to the developers, helps them out, and the people that enjoy the game, it also gets those issues fixed faster.

Not yet. The idea is fun, the lore is very similar to fallout and fallen earth, which I love. Yet this game has a very long way to go before it can be called a game. Maybe one day but definately not worth the money right now. As a free experience - knock yourself out and give them some feedback.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis is a good game but needs a lot of PVP and hud fixes - let me add to my points. For the PVP problem the minute I exited the starting area 5 other real people were waiting for me and killed me within seconds (made me laugh tbh) but on a serious note this IS a major problem as some people would want to enjoy the game and not die HOWEVER I think the PVP side is quite fun and I imagine so do many other people - my advice? either double the servers (one being with allowed PVP and the other with PVP disabled) or do what SWTOR did and only allow certain areas to be PVP if this is impossible (as I have no idea how difficult it is to add those two things) possibly get rid of the PVP element as this will ruin the game for some people. For the hud problems the map acually expanded across the whole screen in a bitty unreadable fashion (if the map was legible as a map I probably would not be adding this but it was clearly an error). HOWEVER I AM LOOKING FORWARD TO THIS GAME the graphics are great, the combat is alright (for a alpha) and the quest system isnt confusing asf like in other mmorpgs so in conclusion I would rate this as a 4/10 now but could imagine a 10/10 if this game recives the support and dedication it deserves.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

From post on forums

Im going to make a list of changes and stuff this game needs, or I forsee a sharp decline in playerbase after people play more than a few hours. I get that this is an alpha, this is for the devs, not you salty steam ♥♥♥♥ wads to comment on.

1. Obviously less lag. (it gets bad sometimes)
2. A bank for storing items (noone i know has found one)
3. Bump and other stone weapons need more range, and raiders and other bandit archtypes need more loot drop chance and less range. The starter shotgun shouldnt be vastly better simply because all ranges are the same.
4. Bump and other stone weapons need damage buff
5. Crafting mat req needs nerf
6. Using merchants to repair needs to not be relative to player skill... should only cost money.
7. Raiders/bandits need aggro bugs fixed.
8. Getting better weapons shouldnt be so impossible. Crafting mat requirements are insane, and need more mats than someone can hold via inv weight, and shouldnt take so long to craft (given that everything needs parts which can only be crafted one at a time and its like a minute a pop).... its just stupid. Also, everything is super expensive. Like SUPER expensive.
9. Better balance overall.
10. The game can be difficult, thats cool, but the slope of progression after level 6ish is stupid. its gonna take me a week to get a better gun, especially because im overweight with mats for them. -.-

I have bought the lifetime premium for 15 bucks, kinda a waste of money, but i wont ask for it back. This game has alot of potential and its fun for an hour or so, after the novelty wears off (and it does quick) this game becomes a pile of ♥♥♥♥.

Killing people with a stick outside of town shouldnt be the funnest aspect of the game.

Fix the balance of some guns, make progression just a LITTLE easier, put a ♥♥♥♥ing bank in the game, and it should be good to go.

I also understand that this is an Alpha and the steam kids are gonna throw that at me like they know something about life, but honestly, i have played alot of alphas, and this is one of the worse off ones. Yet one of the best concepts for a game i have seen in a while. I get that its an alpha and things will change, but there are alot of concepts and mechanics that arent working out AT ALL. Its to the point that even the handful of devs shouldve realized that after a few hours of playing legit its a little redundant and hard to progress or even enjoy yourself.

Use my 15 bucks to the best of your ability. But i wont be recommending this to anyone. Sorry fellas.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is SO incredibly laughably bad. Absolutely horrendous graphics, very weird and incoherent dialogue at the very beginning of the game, absolutely NO direction in story or quests (you have to run around yourself and find one, no chain quests. Also practically no story), can be crazy laggy, can't turn while sprinting, and no sort of tutorial. Nice loading screen art, but besides that it's the only thing I like about this game. The reviews are VERY misleading, people saying that it's good/alright. Bottom line, this game needs to be scrapped. Completely redone. I do believe this has potential if that happens. But as of right now, it completely stinks. Would not recommend to even my worst enemy.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Another game that could have been great if it was Buy to Play.
Instead, you get both:

- A premium system that is expensive (10$ / month OR, before may 16th, 15$ for life (!)) and speeds up exp and money gain (that could be okay for me, to be honest), AND really speeds up crafting (which is quite long without premium on purpose, I guess).

- A cash purchase system, allowing you to get very large amount of currency for real money. Very, very large.

Outside of the sad money-making model, well, it's early access. There are good ideas here and there. A lot of work to do in order to call that a complete game, but the foundations are okay.
However, this economic model is a major turn-off for me (playing is not rewarding because you can progress extremely faster thanks to cash buy).

My quest to find the perfect MMO continues

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*GREAT POTENTIAL*CAUTION I USE POTENTIAL A LOT IN THE REVIEW AND THIS IS JUST MY OPINION*

In the review I post I will have a longer summary for people lower down and a overall. People that just want a quick pro's and con's in my opinion it is at the top.

PRO's (mostly just potential and interest)
- Potential
- Like a Fallout online
- Devs seem to be working
- Interesting clan system
- Interesting stat mechanic
- Player diologue is entertaining

CON's
- Its in a hardcore Alpha
- Safe zone/ Bad zone is kinda bs right now
- Voice actors are ♥♥♥♥
- Characters are boring
- OP ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s
- BUGS LOTS OF BUGS
- Bad combat with NPC's

LONG SUMMARY
The game currently is a mess. UI is ♥♥♥♥ed, NPC's are not interesting, and bugs everywhere. HOWEVER a lot of aspects to the game are interesting and devs seem to be improving it constantly. Most of the people disliking on the game forget how ALPHA this game actually is. The stat system, clan, and the way things seems to be going interest me and if done right can make this game amazing.

This game reminds me a lot of Fallout and when I say a lot I mean a lot! The game is set in a wasteland kind of deal and some dialoge options can allow you to be this ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. One of the few I experianced was getting to call some kid that was being a ♥♥♥♥ a little ♥♥♥♥." I find this game as of now and most likely the future to need friends to be fun and I say that because of the clan system added to the game. I feel like this system can put out this big pvp vibe that I love in MMO's that is honestly in my opinion needed for the way they are taking this game.

This game does even for an extreme alpha look like bad potential also such as the safe zone/ bad zone thing. I think there should be a safe zone for the main questing and that there is a route for the safety zone. Another thing with the safe zone ♥♥♥♥ DO SOMETHING WITH THE OP ♥♥♥♥S. At the rate of what the safe zone thing is going they should rethink it and do lots of changes to it. It makes the game not fun when ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s go in and out of the border line for safety so they can just swoop in and out to kill you. Characters need better more inviting/evil voices. some remind me of when I was in Juinor High and there was that one kid who had no experession and sounded like a robot. Another thing is Dialoge and I'm not going to be harsh on this at all because I feel like this is an easy thing to be fixed and its kinda just opinion
date: but maybe more options plz I would to see new options more like fallout new vegas or fallout 3. Bugs are huge also
recommended: but thats a basic thing with alphas they just need to make sure to fix them. Last but not least on my cons is graphics. To be real I think judging a game on its graphics is dumb
hoursPlayed:
but I know there are people that strongly want "pretty graphics" so I'm putting it in my cons for those people because the game is kinda like eeehhhh on the graphic side of things it isn't smooth even with the highest setting and I'm mostly putting this down upon the things of building and people and such.

OVERALL
Great potential
voteText: Lots of basic cons that can be fixed and some that arn't basic that NEED to be fixed

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Alpha of potential great MMORPG in the future!
You are in this big city called Kimary where you get your own quests and buy stuff off from traders. From here you will travel trough different parts of world!

Build up your own Clan if you like and craft different things like armor, guns etc. Enemies spawn pretty fast and by that are pretty tough because good aiming is critical!

Here is few mission types that I encounter while I was playing:
Get stuff and bring it back
Go and kill those enemies or creatures
Craft these things for me
Pros
Great Customization
Ability to great your own clans
Interesting environment
Can craft things
Cons
Servers crash often and are laggy sometime
Map does not have names for people or shops
Some of quests things are pretty darn hard to find

Conclusion: Pretty interesting MMORPG with FPS elements that will have potential in future if development is constant!



Played on:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Taking into consideration the game is in Early Access, I would not recommend it just yet due to the bugginess, unstable servers and lack of any sort of direction after the tutorial. Wandered around town for an hour looking for any quests to do because killing mobs for xp, at least in the early levels, nets almost nothing.

A few things that others have stated before and I would suggest as fixes for making the game more enjoyable:

1. Add more slots to the crafting queue so I don't have to wait 30 minutes to make a jacket only to then add boots which takes another half hour to make.

2. Premium is pretty much ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. G1 put huge limitations on Fallen Earth's free to play state similar to The Skies and it didn't work for them as Fallen Earth is practically dead now. Adding cosmetics, xp boost/money boost and even boosted loot drops (hell, even throw in ammo, just not the guns, into the shop) is all fine as long as you don't limit the basic gameplay. That's what phone games do. Don't be a phone game.

3. As others have said, raiders with bats and dogs are fine, but then raiders with guns turn into elite badasses that can hit a fly from ten paces away, all the while firing much faster than your pile of garbage gun from the tutorial. Sure, there aren't nearly as many gun-toting elite snipers as there are dudes with sticks and half a tire strapped to their chest, but that doesn't mean they don't pose a huge threat. Speaking of, the scarabs are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Their base move speed is just barely below my sprint speed, so running away is the only option which is good to know except for they're right next to where you get dropped out of the tutorial.

4. Some NPCs will have a question mark by their icon on the mini-map. That does not always mean the NPC will have a quest for you. It may mean they have a part to play in a quest you have to go through all of town trying to fidn the right NPC to trigger said quest then get to the part in said quest where you have to talk to question mark NPC. Also the lack of direction with the quests does not help. One of the quest steps was to find a little kid in the fabric factory. There is no direction to where this factory is or where it's in or out of town (it's in town, by the way). And the kid himself was standing off in a corner trying to camoflauge into some boxes like a little ♥♥♥♥.

So yeah, it has some potential, but just because it has potential doesn't mean it's good, it only has the potential to be good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

When you start to run this game, you will most likely will stuck at the fence. Many people stuck there :D But after that I didn’t meet any bug. Maybe someday…

Pros
-Progression of game is very fast
-Cars work well enough, riding control is quite soft.
-Weapons craft and dressings very affordable
-Exploration become better and better
-Community is helpful

Cons
-Optimization for weak computers still in progress
- Glitches galore, though you were warned
- From time to time not so many players online.
Conclusion: Get it and in general you won’t be disapponted. Need more players :3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can say with hand on heart that this game has lived up to every expectation I had for it.

Obviously, there are many bugs and issues that need to be sorted out (as it's an Alpha) but tonight, in the first 30 minutes of playing on densely populated servers, I killed someone in a way that made me feel so guilty, and has now effected how I will be playing The Skies. If such an event, which evokes such an interesting response from myself, occurs in the very first public Alpha build?.. Just you wait until you see this game evolve.

Props to the entire Eforb Team. You did it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After roughly playing this game at friend’s home I decided to install it too, and I decided to write an honest review. I have enjoyed it so far, Although my review is going to be washed down by all the negatives I just want get my review out there. The Skies has been in early access for a short time and some people just don’t read the note displayed on the Skies Steam Page THAT IS AN EARLY ACCESS GAME. As a short answer I would say you will meet bugs, developers do what they can to improve (and they really work, I feel it patch by patch).
Pro's
Realistic unlike some other post-nuclear ♥♥♥♥♥♥mes.
Really big map that takes a lot of your time and does not keep you board.
Balanced weapons.
Thats really it i cant remember anything else :3
Con's
It seems like loot quite random, I mean too random.
Want more weapons and equipment
Boss killed himself :D

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe world of The Skies is amazing. Character, story, combat, rpg, weapon, world physics, costuming, sound, MUSIC, addictive bosses and gratuitous violence elements are pretty much all spot on. Just look around you, see those marauders? You know what to do. That one scene/place contains so many stories and walking characters in the distance and close up, it's really something I've never seen before. The mayhem you can cause with these selection of weapons when jacked up on the right substances is beyond belief and truly righteous!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tons of fun, and decent replay value.
The leveling seems a bit off.
It is NOTHING like fallout(post-nuclear atmosphere found in many films and games), but it is fun in its own right.
It’s more like a shooter+RPG+social aspect.
Build you super-killer character, skill build can be different and you can have your own car!
So I like the game and would recommend it.
Though I have to say I miss the fallout/fallout 2 days

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI can't describe in words what this game means. For me, it is more than just a game. It reminds me of a time, far back, when this meant a lot for me and times were a little bit different. It kept me company through the years, since recently, always giving me joy. If you haven't played this yet, you're a failure. Thank you for existing The Skies, I will always hold you dear in my memories. I always will support such an ambitious developer.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Imagine yourself in a world that consists of daily routine and hard work. A small room for your house and  for your neighbors. You don’t know what lies beyond the safety of… your house. The Skies takes you on a never seen before adventure in a videogame that still shocks and awes people. An enormously big world filled with tons of stuff with 100’s of quests and people, The Skies is an amazingly fun game to explore.
It takes place in the post-apocalyptic desert which has 100’s of interesting places and even more terrifying creatures. With everything from compounds to abandon buildings, you will come across everything from raiders to town dwellers to the camps and more!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Overall The Skies is rather good. I am always busy with school, and The Skies was the game I needed. It’s not time consuming, and doesn't require daily check ins like most games. The Skies also has endless play time, if you think you're done... Make a new character with a new build. Think it out and be unique. It gets harder the more unique your class. I recommend The Skies, it is wonderful. I waited for a long time for something like this. A little more simple MMO for the newer gamers, but with friends in turns into a very funny game! Give it a try, I am not disapointed at all.
Go out, explore, and explore again after you've explored. You'd be amazed at what you find.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pros:
-Gameplay which is not overly complicated, can relax and play any style, any way you want.
-Main Story, very well thought out, many different turns.
-Almost unlimited playtime!
-Shooter game? Nah, RPG with shooter elements!
-Cover system, killing bosses from covers fills me with determination.
-Several different types of guns, weapons.
-Endless builds. Make your character how you want, and do what you want.
-Character customization simple, but effective.
-Many different bosses, types of mobs. Nice ingame Lore.
-Individual parts for crafting, recipes and nice loot system
-Trust no one, trust nothing. Everything has a possible trap!
-Can I cook? :3

Cons:
-Random FPS drops do happen.
-Sometimes I have freezes for couple of seconds, not sure where is the problem
- Campers killed me at the very beginning 2 times :3

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game definitely has some potential, but at the moment I reccomend staying far far away from this.

The optimization is awful, with a decent gaming rig I'm only getting around 15 FPS on the lowest settings. That's just awful. Even for an Alpha this pretty bad. I've played plenty of Early Acess games and none of them run this bad. It's like watching a quadruple amputee run through tar.

Then there's the voice acting. It's bad. Real bad. It sounds like they rounded up the staff, made sure they could barely speak English, then had them read the lines once.

Then there's the text. It's also bad. Most of it doesn't make much sense.

Then there's the animations. Also bad. They're extremely clunky and look really stiff. Melee attacks just look terrible and the running animation is even worse.

I could go on, but with it being a 3.3 GB download, you should just get the game yourself and see the awfulness in full effect. It's almost hilarious how bad it is.

A few years of development and this game might actually be worth playing.

Oh and one final note, make sure to try lockpicking. It's so terrible it's hilarious.
