reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fried Chicken and Waffle Cones
Serves: 8

Waffle Cones:

2 eggs
1/2 cup white sugar
1/4 cup butter, melted and cooled
3 tablespoons milk
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/3 cup all-purpose flour
1/8 teaspoon salt
3 tablespoons vegetable oil

Fried Chicken:

1 pound of chicken, diced into bite-sized pieces
1 cup buttermilk
1 cup bread crumbs
2 cups all purpose flour, for dredging
2 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoon paprika
1 teaspoon ground black pepper
1/2 teaspoon onion powder
1/2 teaspoon cayenne
1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
2 quarts vegetable oil, for frying

For the Waffle Cones:

Form or find a cone shape in any size you prefer. I used wadded tin foil, but bottles, or whatever cone-like object you have on hand will work just as well.
Whisk the eggs and sugar together until frothy, then gradually add the butter, milk, vanilla, and cinnamon. In tablespoon increments, incorporate flour and salt. The resulting batter should be really thin (more runny than pancake batter).
If you have a pizelle iron, now is the time to bust it out. If not, a skillet will work too, you’ll just be without the waffle pattern. Brush whatever skillet you’re using with oil and pour 1/8 cup of the batter onto it. Cook until both sides are golden brown, flipping often. Once it’s finished, wrap the unformed cone around whatever object you’ve acquired to form the cone shape. Allow to cool completely before removing from object. Repeat to use up batter.
For the Fried Chicken:

Place diced chicken in a bowl, top with spices and buttermilk, and toss to coat. Add bread crumbs and flour and toss again until pieces are separated and evenly coated.
Pour oil into a medium saucepan over medium heat and fry chicken pieces 4 minutes, or until golden brown. Using a slotted spoon, remove chicken from oil and drain on a drying rack.
To assemble:

Fill each waffle cone with 1/4 cup mashed potatoes and sprinkle with fried chicken bites.
Drizzle with maple syrup and enjoy!

Early Access Review

OK this game is not playable CULLING works well DEVs. Your settings are GLITCHED i.e LOW and AVERAGE are connected and HIGH/Ultra are tandam. . . CPU usage is the same on every setting LOW CPU 30% GPU usage is idle at 15-20% ram is taking up about 8 gigs. I was disconnected once and my frames went to 60(vsync) in town with everyones toons running in place so the toons animation and amount of people do not hinder the CPU or GPU .... my opinion is the bottlenecking in the network stalls... everything seems to tic at the same time when it comes to those low 20 fps in town.....p2p application may be an issue.. nothing changes for usage from outside of town and inside.... I would play this game more in depth but the MMORPG lag that haunts old school games is pushing me away.... should of built this game with forgelight.

PS.... put all stats in INT and exploit your skills -_- Morrowind style haha

reviewText:

Early Access Review

So...  It's not bad...  But it's not good, either.  It's clearly early access which means I have every reason to believe it *will* be great, but not for a year or so.  As someone who favors the MMORPG genre, here's my pro/con list:

--Pros--
-All the quests I encountered in my short time had full audio - barely had to read anything.  I like that, it's submersive.
-Travel didn't seem to take *too* long.
-Post-apocalypse atmosphere is decent.  If the game wasn't so early and I could have gotten into it, I would have felt submersed in an apocalyptic wasteland.

--Cons--
-Gunplay is shoddy at best.  Many times I missed at point blank with a shotgun simply because I was moving...  That's just sillyness.
-When you're in a quest dialog it sometimes gives you 2 or 3 options to reply and for the most part it felt like the other options were just extra" or there for asthetics
date: serving little or no purpose.\n-Very little guidance with quests...  This can be a good thing if you're like me and don't like the "hand holding" of recently-made MMO's
recommended: however from the time I started until the time I said
hoursPlayed: "screw this"
voteText: I felt like I had no idea what I was supposed to be doing.\n\nAll in all I say it's a decent game.  Pick it up and try it.  Certainly doesn't deserve a negative review - these devs are trying damn hard and honestly this game has serious potential.  Give it a try if you like the genre.  If you're able to get past the shoddyness in it's current state and get into it
helpfulPercent: the game can only get better from here."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

O jogo aparenta seguir o padrão semelhante ao do Fallout em termos de construção de personagem, construção de equipamento, etc... Digo aparenta, porque ainda está em alpha. Acho que pode ter futuro se for bem desenvolvido, era bom que alguns jogadores de fonline dessem aqui um salto para colaborarem com os desenvolvedores.

Como está em Alpha, algumas funcionalidades não funcionam correctamente, ainda que sejam bugs menores. O que considero ser um grande problema para este jogo é a falta de maturidade dos utilizadores, e scriptkiddies a tentar mandar o jogo a baixo que poderam representar a maioria da comunidade.

The game appears to follow a pattern similar to Fallout in terms of character construction, crafting system, stats. When i say it appears its because the game is still in alpha and there might be a lot of changes depending the maturity of this game comunity. This can turn out to be a great game if well developed and it would have a lot to win if members of fonline would come to colaborate with the devs with tips.

While there's some features that do not work, they all seem to be minor bugs, glitches that can be fixed without affecting the gameplay. Ex.: (this is according to my experience)
- mouse sensitivity bar in settings does not work
- toggling between Character control and free mouse sometimes bugs
- double clicking armour wont switch with the one equipped
- stuff can be picked up from the other side of the wall

The website/servers are now undergoing stress from DDoS, hack attempts, some players are trying to exploit the game and initially it will suck but it will help devs to find the exploits and close them before releasing the game.

Actualização: Tendo em conta que o jogo ainda está em alpha, parece seguir o caminho de item shop extremo, craft de 15 minutos para cima e somente um item por vez, tem-se de pagar para ter mais slots disponiveis, upgrades sao cobrados pela moeda paga no jogo.
Os mobs aparentam ser overkill mas pode ser por causa de estar em alpha.

Update: While the game is still in Alpha, it starts to show its path with extreme item shop dependent, upgrade items are pay2win with paid currency, crafting queue slots are also paid and most crafts will be 15min up.
Mobs appear to be overkill, but it might be because its still alpha.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Early Access Watcher Reviews The Skies

Update Version: Alpha Patch #4

Disclosure: It was free on download, used the free premium weekend for part of the review

Right of the bat, I cannot in good faith recommend this product. I usually go into detail about key aspect such as story and gameplay, but the bugs and micro transactions will take main focus. Story is scattered in loading screen panels and very awkward voice acting with quests hidden behind NPC interactions. Visually the game feels like it was made in 2009, but it is not awful. The music is rather forgetful with sound effects drowning the speakers in gun fire and scarab clicks. Combat works, but the enemy AI switches from charge happy to standing until killed. UI is rather clunky with simple tasks such as sorting the inventory and interacting with the environment becoming frustrating. Alright, now to the big killers: bugs.

This game could have the greatest story ever told, gameplay that produced liquid joy and visuals which blinded you from pure beauty, but it all means nothing if it can barely hold itself up. The sheer volume of bugs, glitches and errors in this game is staggering; most require the player to exit the game and log back in just to fix. Guns and gear do not equip properly, being overburdened does not hinder movement, some stats do not do what they are suppose to do (Dexterity and Oratory for instance), selling items does not register, and other action graphics can become stuck on your character (pick axe was always visible after a failed node). Terrain appears unfinished with invisible flooring, the few items in barren homes will float in the air, NPCs are seen stuck in objects or walking into walls, enemies will just stand still when hit or appear to be stuck in place with you taking melee damage from them 6 yards away and gathering can get you stuck in the animation. I even got trapped in a staircase and a doorframe on multiple occasions. It just screams of sloppy design and poor self-checking, especially with the stats that fail to work.

Crashes, disconnects, frame rate inconsistency: the trifecta of annoyance. Crashes can happen from simply changing zones to reviving after being killed. Disconnects are rather few and far between, but it happens when the server load starts to get high. Frame rate personally stuck around 20-30 on Ultra settings, but I know of other players dipping into single digits. Mix these problems in with the bugs and you can see how it would feel tiresome just to complete a simple fetch quest.

Now for the controversial topic: micro transactions. It is a well known fact many games depend on them for the revenue to continue updating, but the problem starts to arise when the service provided affects gameplay so much. Thanks to the free weekend, I have been able to see the difference. XP gain, currency gain, crafting slots, time required to craft, it all becomes easier in Premium. This could be seen as a pay to win set up, especially with the amount of coins you get compared to normal player. For a game still in alpha, it is rather interesting to have working micro transactions when so many areas still need basic work. Just an observation.

PvP is always an issue of grievers and balance, so when I discovered how many people decided to camp outside town before the recent update it was clear why the safe areas were constructed. The game just screams effort, but like this constant threat of player attacks the game feels too frustrating when you fear the next bug could get you killed outside your quest destination. I do not know how long it would take before this game could be considered reliable, but at this point it would be more effort than payoff to play it. There are plenty of other MMO style games out there with less pay to win influence to tied you over while this gets further down the programming line.

Pros

- Safe zones at least promise you won't be player killed
- Plenty to do if you can get far enough in

Cons

- It needs heavy optimization
- Open PvP halts most progress
- Micro Transactions (that feel pay to win)
- UI about as frustrating as enemy AI

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is some what playable. I would stay away from it for now until it recieves major updates.

As of right now:

First there is a game breaking bug which occurs when you try and trade with a NPC. Every single time I go to trade it opens up and my inventory is blank / the npc's inventory is blank and cannot trade anything. It also says I have 0 coin but when I look to the upper left it clearly states I have 2400. Also if you click trade and exit out and then try to speak to ANYONE the menu disappears and the only thing you can do is trade again. No accepting quests, no speaking to anyone; it just automatically brings up trade with the above bug. I end up having to quit the game every time but the bug still occurs.

AI in this game isn't innovative and they have some serious auto-aiming capabilities. When you enter a building with multiple AI they go absolutely bat ♥♥♥♥ crazy. All you can hear is gun shots even though they don't have sight of you. I've had to mute my game because it doesn't cease. Some of them will even 1 shot you. Sometimes they even melee / shoot you at the same time doing double damage. They will also chase you to for what seems like 2-3 minutes.

This game looks promising and it isn't all bad. The crafting system is okay" at best and if there weren't timers it would be great. Typical grindy feeling which is everywhere nowadays. PvP "KoS (kill on sight)" was fixed outside of the main town which is nice. Voice acting is funny to me although some people dislike it.

This game needs some serious polishing to be great. Yeah I know it's alpha and It's alright for what it is."

Early Access Review

What to say about this game? Surprising. It's early access so i expect the bugs and they can get pretty annoying because the accuracy isnt percise and half the missions dont work properly... But that can be fixed. Whats unique about this game is that the choices you make are important. If you decide to pick an electronic lock and fail to succed... Guess what?... PRISON! Doesn't sound fun but its a unique system that punishes you but doesnt set you back to square 1. Most of the hate on this game is because of the bugs, but as i said before, it can be fixed. I consider myself a fan of this game and will support it until the beta where i can make a final decision. If they dont fix the major bugs then we've got some bad developers. If they do... WE PILLAGE VILLAGES

Early Access Review

Ok, so i never write reviews but this game deserves mentioning. so to start off of course theres bugs its early alpha so whatever we all know theres bugs.
now despite being disconnected constantly glitching getting killed... A LOT. this game is immensly fun, and has sooo so so much potential and could very well become an amazing game i mean truly amazing. the voice acting is corny but in an appreciative way, the characters are pretty comical and the world itself looks fantastic especially for the current state of the game. So for anyone reading the negative reviews most of them are just hating on a game that could become an all around amazing fully fun and playable game, and seriously this deserves to be tried out at least download and try it for a few hours and get captivated as i did. kudos to the devs for getting my hopes up that theres finally a game that suits my tastes to a tee.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Restoring my review to a simple version: (Also Honest)

>Animations are simple and Oblivion like
>Very little character customization
>Extremely P2W in Alpha
>Cars cost $100-150 USD (#THESKIES a 2016 walking simulator)
>Crafting is so tedious it actually isn't used
>Instancing for quests is buggy
>Quests can be failed and never accepted again
>Graphic settings are buggy if messed with
>Items are purchased at NPCs not gathered
>Mobs have 100% perfect accuracy
>Stat system has very unuseful skills
>Respecs cost near $10 USD
>NPCs dont always show they have quests
>Weapon stats are horribly described
>Hit boxes are horrid
>There is no armor variant, only heavy armor

>Basically in a fallout 1, 2, 3, and 4 players perspective, the only thing that could save this game is much needed hard work on bug fixes and a total reworking of questing, crafting, currency, customization, and combat.. So everything.

I use to think this game could be great, but its so P2W in alpha I think it'll die out before it launches. What the developers are doing to it is disgusting for a free to play perspective.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

The game has a great foundation that gives this game so much potential that it could potentially put other open world survival games to shame. There is not to much to say about it yet since its only been released for so long because it has great ideas however the execution of it is not exactly there yet and will depend on how they decide to do it.

However thats really all it has to it, potential, all it has right now is potential and is not built yet (we should expect this from early access games so its ok). It has MANY technical errors such as but not limited to crashes, getting stuck to objects, glitches with AI and missions, etc but it is a early access game so hopefully it will be fixed which usually it should.

In the end why should you download it? its FREE!!, it has so much potential to be such a great game and any problems they have now should be gone in the future as long as they keep working on the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The Skies-
-Looks pretty nice
-When not buggy (in rare cases), game play is brilliant, unique and character dialogue is hilarious
-It's open world, lots of exploring to do!
-Very nice loot system
-Shooting made with love
-Patches fix many problems for Early Access game every time
-Nice to play with friends
I highly recommend bring some friends with you and enjoy it. (Pay attention to what is hiding....I didn't realize that there are some campers waited for me. I failed once, but my friends avenged me.)

Overall, I give this game a 9/10 even in it's in early access state.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

While the graphics in The Skies look like the graphics we have in good MMOs; there is still some unpleasant bugs. I ‘m trying to play my game safe as it’s my first ever run through shooter-MMO; I was still happy with the way game looks in the safe state, it looks nice. You can get some pretty amazing screenshots from the remote locations you find.
I 100% recommend The Skies to anybody. Even if you aren't a fan of MMO shooter games. The Skies will probably change your mind; this is easily now in my top 5 games of present time and I cannot believe I had not played it until now. If you haven't played The Skies, do it, it's free to play and if you heard about the Skies but haven't played it; please don't wait a second longer, boot this game up and get your self fully immersed in this absolutely wonderful game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Developed by Eforb, The Skies was created by a company that houses a few people, but hardworking to put their love into a game, and whose strengths are writing and solid MMO role-playing mechanics, and it shows. The writing throughout The Skies is commendable, and no matter what type of character you want to play, the game was made with you in mind. You constantly feel rewarded for your playstyle.
Come and see with your own eyes, how a really worthy product looks like. Yes, there is a lot to do to improve the game, mechanics and optimization. Looking forward to see more new players!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It has ridiculous amount of things to do and a RIDICULOUS amount of ways to solve these things. Shoot, shoot, shoot everyone. The graphics are good, although I really care for that since it important for such game; Gameplay is simple and good, with a lot of weapon variation range users; story is fantastic and it is non-linear, what is not usual for a MMO; soundtrack simply good and sounds in general; many RPG variations; and finally difficulty is pretty balanced and varied, sure to fit to anyone's standards.
It does have quite a few bugs and glitches, although most of them are not game breaking and animations are just... awkward, but as I said that’s a normal situation for MMOs.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI've played a lot of post-nuclear games and watched a lot of movies in this setting and that means a lot to me. A power struggle, fickle diplomacy and relations between a great many people and bandits, as well as a war brewing between the weakening reigning power of the players and the upstart of the bandits and, a well-trained army of raiders of near infinite numbers following the none ideals. The gameplay is golden middle between MMO and Shooter. I like both, so that is a good option for me to spend time in the evening.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A wasteland that I would probably go live in if I could. The Skies has a great depth of story, an immersive surrounding and approachable UI and keeps a lot of what it should be. It's also very fascinating and while on its own, it's starting to show its power, with some time and efforts that can be still improved.

The main story is not always the main attraction of some games, and I'd say that for this. I personally had more fund running the many many side missions there are, and having immersing myself in the feeling of being amongst different people trying to make a new life.
Combat is fun, dialogues are well written, and levelling system is well designed. The only downside for me is that the faces of characters do often look slightly soulless and are not incredibly well animated.

But that said, this is one of those «I recommend to try» games and I applause to the developers.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is excellent. Very interesting project by far, and a massive accomplishment. I suppose, many people waited for an online-Fallout. The story is great. The game lets you play the way you want to play - if you decide you don't want to gun down everything in FPS style, you can explore, contacting people, looting. The array of side quests and interesting diversion is massive. Atmosphere was created so well, pulls you in and doesn’t let you go
I can recommend it to anyone who missed games of such type.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOne of my favorite games for now. This 3D immersive world set the stage for how open world FPS/RPG should be done. Best and most quests of any game MMO-Shooter, more adequate players than any MMO f2p, good stories and monsters. Additions such as crafting new ammunition types, survival items, and weapons are great and interesting ways to improve your arsenal, and collecting unique weapons keep the player scouring the entire Wasteland in an addicting frenzy. Every encounter in this desert is a story of it's own, and tons of these emergent moments make up the experience that is The Skies.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game needs a lot of work and rethinking before I would enjoy this.  It's clunky, badly thought out, and doesn't have any path to follow.  Open world games need to have a driving force to make you want to go on an adventure instead of hanging around the starting area for the first couple hours you play it.  It just drops you off in the middle of this town with irritating characters, and enemys too strong to be considered starter enemies.
To get a better gone right off the bat you have to take a quest from this guy magnus.  It involves getting materials for him to make you a gun because he mistook you for some rando who doesn't have a name.  To get said materials you have to raid a bandit camp or find them with unknown methods.  Even if I could kill enough of them I couldn't loot the corpse since I immediately died from the other 20 bandits.  At first I was hopeful this would be a good game.  But then I got one shot by a beetle as soon as left the tutorial area.  On top of having a crappy staring defence/health the combat of this game feels like it's a game from the 1990s not 2016.
I will not be revisiting this game because even if i could do some of the quests the pathways to finish them are single minded and brutish.  I started off trying to get a stubborn doctor from closing his hospital because a kid stole some tools of his, and ended up having to help the kid's mother from having her home reposessed by bribing some dude in a bar.  There is very little explanation and the only common theme is this mysterious place called The Skies."  Give me something important to do!  I want to look for this brother that is mentioned not solving the problems of poeple who are just plain idiots.
"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR version:
Fallout 4 + Hurtworld/H!ZI + Connection to the server lost = this

Longer version:
The Skies is a mix of Fallout 4 along with survival game such as HW or DayZ. Overall the lore is pretty not interesting, but let's be honest here - who looks for good lore in multiplayer game? Lel.
The combat system i pretty solid in schemes - powerfull hits close with melee weapon and good long range shooting.

In schemes.

In reality the range of melee weapons is insanely big. I had a stupid handmade assalut rifle and got killed from the other side of the spot by guy with club. Ridiculous.

The Quests are bugging pretty often. I had one with delivering the package to the mayor in the first city.
The bandits got bugged and one of them dissapeared. When I went out the doors closed and I am not able to do the quest (well maybe if I abandoned it, dunno if you really can xd).

There is suppoused to be a crafting" system along with "collecting" system. Resources are hard to find and usually require tons of points in travelling skill. That's a nope.

Oh yea
date: and quests are pretty much similar: go to X
recommended:
take Y amounts of Z and come back or kill X Y times to get Z and bring it to me. Smth like this.

The biggest disadvantage of this game tho is connection. You will be kicked out from the server really often. This gets annoying and sometimes breaks the quests or game experience.

BUT!
Note that the game is in early alpha and not all things are suppoused to work correcly. I do not really get the idea for "early access" or "early alpha". You should rather release a full game with no bugs instead of bugged not-finished game.

But watcha gonna do.

Updates may make this review outdated so i guess for a conclusion i may say this:
So far this is a decent game. It does not bring anything special to survival FPS games similar to this kind (DayZ
hoursPlayed: Nether
voteText: H!ZI
helpfulPercent: Hurtword
votesHelpful: Rust
votesTotal: etc.). If you are a fan of Fallout 4 and survival and you don't mind a game kicking you each 30+ minutes - play it."
votesFunny: May 4
commentsCount: true

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I see soooo much potential in this game.
1) Open World PVP
2) Clan wars
3) Capturing and Defending bases
4) Vehicles
5) In depth Crafting

However in its current state the game is ridden with bugs, horrendous voice acting, and optimization problems.

But i will continue to play this game due to the fact of the potential this game has to offer. If done correctly, this game can become amazing.

Recommendations:
Better Direction for quests (Mostly a personal preference, but i hate feeling lost trying to find a quest, or complete one)
Better optimization
Spawn noobies in the town, after the tutorial i found myself and many others being killed and just being thrown into the town.

Those are just my recommendation since i only have 2 hours into the game, however i will edit this review when updates start hitting the game. The devolopers are doing a good job at showing that they want feedback and to want to make this game amazing.

Give this game a chance, at least to help the devolopers with feedback and advice.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Don't bother downloading it.

The developers really needed to wait before releasing this. The UI is completely unintuitive, the explanation of how the RPG systems work is awful, there are bugs in the starting area in the quests you HAVE to do to leave, and the server infrastructure is terrible, lots of players teleporting around. I can live with the low quality voice acting (it's honestly quite funny how bad it is) and mediocre textures and models (texture seams everywhere) but the gameplay really has nothing to offer. There are far better alternatives out there for your post-apocalyptic survival fix.

Don't let negative reviews distract you. It is true,
codename for this game should be Bug, because thats all it is sometimes, but its Early Access so if and when they fix everything this will be a really good game and even might say its gonna be in top tear f2p games. Would recommend, just be aware that its Early Access Game, so its really buggy and might not even start up for you, and don't think have a high end rig will make you superior here.

I give it 7/10   Once they fix everything it will be a good game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game needs a lot of work and rethinking before I would enjoy this.  It's clunky, badly thought out, and doesn't have any path to follow.  Open world games need to have a driving force to make you want to go on an adventure instead of hanging around the starting area for the first couple hours you play it.  It just drops you off in the middle of this town with irritating characters, and enemys too strong to be considered starter enemies.
To get a better gone right off the bat you have to take a quest from this guy magnus.  It involves getting materials for him to make you a gun because he mistook you for some rando who doesn't have a name.  To get said materials you have to raid a bandit camp or find them with unknown methods.  Even if I could kill enough of them I couldn't loot the corpse since I immediately died from the other 20 bandits.  At first I was hopeful this would be a good game.  But then I got one shot by a beetle as soon as left the tutorial area.  On top of having a crappy staring defence/health the combat of this game feels like it's a game from the 1990s not 2016.
I will not be revisiting this game because even if i could do some of the quests the pathways to finish them are single minded and brutish.  I started off trying to get a stubborn doctor from closing his hospital because a kid stole some tools of his, and ended up having to help the kid's mother from having her home reposessed by bribing some dude in a bar.  There is very little explanation and the only common theme is this mysterious place called The Skies."  Give me something important to do!  I want to look for this brother that is mentioned not solving the problems of poeple who are just plain idiots.
"
